response:
A focal right midbrain syndrome in a 48-year-old man with a 6-week history and no systemic illness most likely reflects a structural brainstem lesion; ischaemic midbrain stroke is epidemiologically common, but the subacute time course also raises demyelinating and neoplastic or vascular malformation causes, with metastasis and granulomatous disease considered in the absence of known systemic disease.

differential_diagnosis = ["Ischaemic midbrain stroke (paramedian branch of posterior cerebral artery)", "Brainstem demyelinating plaque due to multiple sclerosis", "Cavernous malformation of the right midbrain with subacute haemorrhage", "Intrinsic right midbrain glioma", "Metastatic brain tumour to the right midbrain", "Neurosarcoidosis involving the right midbrain"]
